Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Ultrasound-Guided Erector Spinae Plane Block and Quadratus Lumborum Block for Analgesia in Laparoscopic Nephrectomy

Trial_Design.evidence: In this single-center, double-blind, randomised controlled trial, 54 patients aged 18–70 years with ASA grades I–II were recruited

Participants.evidence: 54 patients aged 18–70 years with ASA grades I–II were recruited from Sichuan Provincial People’s Hospital

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1 to receive either ESPB or QLB with 25 mL of 0.4% ropivacaine

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to directly compare the analgesic effectiveness and recovery benefits of ultrasound-guided erector spinae plane block (ESPB) versus quadratus lumborum block (QLB)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was cumulative morphine consumption within 6 hours postoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using opaque envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was maintained for patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors

Number_Randomised.evidence: 54 patients aged 18–70 years with ASA grades I–II were recruited from Sichuan Provincial People’s Hospital between August 16, 2023, and October 30, 2023

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of the 54 patients randomised, 27 were allocated to each group

Result_Outcome.evidence: ESPB resulted in significantly lower morphine consumption within 6 hours postoperatively compared to QLB (mean difference: 2.52 mg, 95% CI: 0.15–4.89; P=0.04)

Harms.evidence: No block-related complications were observed in either group

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial Registration: Chinese Clinical Trial Registry, ChiCTR2300074743
